  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      public Account createAccount(AccountCredentials accountCredentials)
      Create a new account.
      Parameters:
      accountCredentials - credentials containing desired username and password
      Returns:
      the created Account representation
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityExistsException - if an account with the same username already exists

    • loginAccount

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> loginAccount(AccountCredentials credentials)
      Authenticate user credentials and create a session cookie. This method validates the provided credentials, generates and persists a session token, and returns an HTTP response with a Set-Cookie header containing the session value.
      Parameters:
      credentials - username and password to authenticate
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with Set-Cookie header on success (HTTP 200)
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the account with the given username does not exist
      InvalidCredentialsException - if the password is incorrect

    • logoutAccount

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> logoutAccount(String cookie)
      Logout the user by deleting the session referenced in the provided cookie and returning a cleared session cookie (max-age 0).
      Parameters:
      cookie - raw Cookie header value from the request
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with cleared session cookie (HTTP 204)
      Throws:
      InvalidCredentialsException - when no valid session cookie is present or token is invalid

    • getCurrentAccount

      public Account getCurrentAccount(String cookie)
      Return the Account associated with the session cookie value.
      Parameters:
      cookie - raw Cookie header value from the request
      Returns:
      Account corresponding to the session
      Throws:
      InvalidCredentialsException - when cookie is missing, malformed, or token is invalid

    • validateSession

      public SessionJpa validateSession(String cookie)
      Validate the given cookie and return the persisted SessionJpa entity. This will throw InvalidCredentialsException when the cookie is missing or malformed, or when the token does not correspond to a stored session.
      Parameters:
      cookie - raw Cookie header value from the request
      Returns:
      SessionJpa representing the stored session
      Throws:
      InvalidCredentialsException - when cookie is missing, malformed, or token not found

    • isValidSession

      public boolean isValidSession(String cookie)
      Quick check whether the provided cookie represents an existing, valid session.
      Parameters:
      cookie - raw Cookie header value from the request
      Returns:
      true when a valid session exists for the cookie, false otherwise
